title: European Communities (Finance) Act 2008
text:
The European Communities (Finance) Act 2008 (c. 1) is an <a href="Act%20of%20Parliament">Act</a> of the <a href="Parliament%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">Parliament of the United Kingdom</a>. It was given <a href="Royal%20Assent">Royal Assent</a> and became law on 19 February 2008.
Passage.
The legislation was introduced to the <a href="House%20of%20Commons%20of%20the%20United%20Kingdom">House of Commons</a> as the European Communities (Finance) <a href="Bill%20%28proposed%20law%29">Bill</a> by the <a href="Chancellor%20of%20the%20Exchequer">Chancellor of the Exchequer</a>, <a href="Alistair%20Darling">Alistair Darling</a>, on 7 November 2007. The Bill was read for the third time in the House of Commons on 15 January 2008 and passed to the <a href="House%20of%20Lords">House of Lords</a> with a vote of 309 for to 208 against. 
Effect.
The Act passes into UK law the decisions on the <a href="Budget%20of%20the%20European%20Union">European Union budget</a> taken at the <a href="European%20Council">European Council</a> meeting of December 2005 as recorded in the "Council's Decision of 7 June 2007 on the system of the European Communities’ own resources". It does this by amending the introductory paragraph of the <a href="European%20Communities%20Act%201972%20%28UK%29">European Communities Act 1972</a> to include reference to the 7 June 2007 decision. The Act supersedes and repeals the <a href="European%20Communities%20%28Finance%29%20Act%202001">European Communities (Finance) Act 2001</a>.
On 22 May 2008, in answer to a Parliamentary question by <a href="John%20Burnett%2C%20Baron%20Burnett">Lord Burnett</a>, <a href="Bryan%20Davies%2C%20Baron%20Davies%20of%20Oldham">Lord Davies of Oldham</a> provided an estimate on the additional costs to <a href="Her%20Majesty%27s%20Treasury">Her Majesty's Treasury</a> as a result of the Act. The total cost was estimated at between £6.3 billion and £7.2 billion for the financial period 2007 to 2013.
